title: Could a giant lagoon turn Hull into 'one of the most exciting waterfront cities in the world'?
text:
Plans to create a lagoon on the Humber Estuary have been revealed, a project which developers hope will turn Hull into “one of the most exciting waterfront cities in Europe.”

Developers say the lagoon would provide flood protection for the city, while a new 11km relief road on the edge of the lagoon would help to reduce congestion.

It is projected that the £1.5bn development would create up to 14,000 new jobs, a “maritime living environment”, and help regenerate the city’s waterfront.

Tim Rix, who dreamt up the Lagoon Hull project, said: “The Lagoon Hull project is a once-in-a-generation opportunity to transform the future of the region.
